author: bainbrid
body:
#### PR description:

This PR contains:
- code that performs the energy regression as part of the default low-pT electrons RECO sequence 
- run2_miniAOD_UL modifier: schedules the energy regression prior to the PAT sequence (for existing samples)
- a switch to a new BDT model for the electron ID, "2020Nov28"
- selectedPatLowPtElectrons: BDT score threshold tuned to -0.25 to give 10% mistag rate

Studies on the energy regression and ID can be found [here](https://indico.cern.ch/event/983008/contributions/4140140/) and [here](https://indico.cern.ch/event/983567/contributions/4142431/). 

This PR depends on https://github.com/cms-data/RecoEgamma-ElectronIdentification/pull/16

For the UL re-miniAOD campaign, the 2020Sept15 model is used as part of the PAT sequence to select interesting electron candidates (PR https://github.com/cms-sw/cmssw/pull/32372, merged into CMSSW_10_6_20). This PR introduces the new 2020Nov28 model. The following slide provides details on how correlated the two BDT model scores are, and the effect on the 2020Nov28 performance after the application of a threshold of 1.5 on the score from the 2020Sept15 model. These studies are pertinent to e.g. a "UL nanoAOD v9" production based on existing UL re-miniAOD samples. [201223_ID_correlation.pdf](https://github.com/cms-sw/cmssw/files/5774997/201223_ID_correlation.pdf)

#### PR validation:

The new ID has been tested locally with wfs 1325.518 (TTbar reminiAOD) and 136.88811 (JetHT, 2018D) and a comparison made with scores from the previous "2020Sept15" model. The BDT scores are in line with expectations.

The energy regression has been tested with the following wfs and candidate GTs from EGamma:
- 1325.518 (TTbar reminiAOD), tested with 112X_upgrade2018_realistic_Candidate_2020_12_03_11_20_37
- 136.88811 (JetHT, 2018D), tested with 112X_dataRun2_relval_Candidate_2020_12_04_15_09_56

The regressed energies are in line with expectations.
title: LowPtElectrons: final energy regression and ID
